strengths: Several results directly address the possibility of a New Frontiers-class mission to Uranus.
Many results provide strong scientific justification for exploring Uranus, highlighting its unique characteristics and unanswered questions.
Some results discuss different mission architectures and instrument payloads for Uranus exploration.
Many results highlight the importance of Uranus exploration in the context of exoplanet research.
weaknesses: Some results are only tangentially related, focusing on specific aspects of Uranus science without addressing the mission concept study.
A few results describe flagship-class missions, which are outside the scope of the main paper's focus on New Frontiers.
There's a lack of detail in some abstracts regarding specific mission design considerations and trade-offs.
suggestions: Focus future searches on keywords that explicitly include "New Frontiers", "Uranus orbiter", and "mission concept study".
Prioritize results that discuss specific mission design trade-offs, instrument selection rationales, and cost constraints.
Consider searching for white papers or conference presentations that may provide more detailed information than journal abstracts.
